org.turbogwt.ext.gwtp.databind

Class DatabindViewImpl<H extends DatabindUiHandlers>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.ViewImpl
      • com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.ViewWithUiHandlers<H>
        • org.turbogwt.ext.gwtp.databind.DatabindViewImpl<H>
  • Type Parameters:
    H - Your DatabindUiHandlers interface type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IsWidget, com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.HasUiHandlers<H>, com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.View, org.turbogwt.mvp.databind.Binder, org.turbogwt.mvp.databind.DatabindValidationHandler, org.turbogwt.mvp.databind.DatabindView, org.turbogwt.mvp.databind.HasDatabindUiHandler, org.turbogwt.mvp.databind.HasDatabindValues, org.turbogwt.mvp.databind.WidgetBinder

    public class DatabindViewImpl<H extends DatabindUiHandlers>
extends com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.ViewWithUiHandlers<H>
implements DatabindView<H>
    Base class for a DatabindView. You should always call ViewWithUiHandlers.setUiHandlers(com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.UiHandlers) from your presenter's constructor.

    Important! Never call ViewWithUiHandlers.getUiHandlers() inside your constructor since the UiHandlers are not yet set.

    Author:
    Danilo Reinert
